verses.text: I will stand upon my watch , and set me upon the tower , and will watch to see what he will say unto me, and what I shall answer when I am reproved.\f + \fr 2.1 \ft tower: Heb. fenced place\f*\f + \fr 2.1 \ft unto me: or, in me\f*\f + \fr 2.1 \ft when…: or, when I am argued with: Heb. upon my reproof, or, arguing\f*
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* answered me, and said , Write the vision , and make \add it\add* plain upon tables , that he may run that readeth it.
For the vision \add is\add* yet for an appointed time , but at the end it shall speak , and not lie : though it tarry , wait for it; because it will surely come , it will not tarry.
Behold, his soul \add which\add* is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith. \p

¶ Yea also, because he transgresseth by wine , \add he is\add* a proud man , neither keepeth at home , who enlargeth his desire as hell , and \add is\add* as death , and cannot be satisfied , but gathereth unto him all nations , and heapeth unto him all people :\f + \fr 2.5 \ft Yea…: or, How much more\f*

Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say , Woe to him that increaseth \add that which is\add* not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick clay !\f + \fr 2.6 \ft Woe…: or, Ho, he\f*
Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee, and awake that shall vex thee, and thou shalt be for booties unto them?

Because thou hast spoiled many nations , all the remnant of the people shall spoil thee; because of men’s blood , and \add for\add* the violence of the land , of the city , and of all that dwell therein.\f + \fr 2.8 \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f* \p

¶ Woe to him that coveteth an evil covetousness to his house , that he may set his nest on high , that he may be delivered from the power of evil !\f + \fr 2.9 \ft coveteth…: or, gaineth and evil gain\f*\f + \fr 2.9 \ft power…: Heb. palm of the hand\f*
Thou hast consulted shame to thy house by cutting off many people , and hast sinned \add against\add* thy soul.
For the stone shall cry out of the wall , and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.\f + \fr 2.11 \ft beam: or, piece, or, fastening\f*\f + \fr 2.11 \ft answer it: or, witness against it\f* \p
¶ Woe to him that buildeth a town with blood , and stablisheth a city by iniquity !\f + \fr 2.12 \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*

Behold, \add is it\add* not of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts that the people shall labour in the very fire , and the people shall weary themselves for very vanity ?\f + \fr 2.13 \ft for…: or, in vain?\f*
For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, as the waters cover the sea.\f + \fr 2.14 \ft with…: or, by knowing the glory\f* \p
¶ Woe unto him that giveth his neighbour drink , that puttest thy bottle to \add him\add*, and makest \add him\add* drunken also, that thou mayest look on their nakedness !

Thou art filled with shame for glory : drink thou also, and let thy foreskin be uncovered : the cup of the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* right hand shall be turned unto thee, and shameful spewing \add shall be\add* on thy glory.\f + \fr 2.16 \ft with…: or, more with shame than with glory\f*

For the violence of Lebanon shall cover thee, and the spoil of beasts , \add which\add* made them afraid , because of men’s blood , and for the violence of the land , of the city , and of all that dwell therein. \p

¶ What profiteth the graven image that the maker thereof hath graven it; the molten image , and a teacher of lies , that the maker of his work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols ?\f + \fr 2.18 \ft maker of…: Heb. fashioner of his fashion\f*

Woe unto him that saith to the wood , Awake ; to the dumb stone , Arise , it shall teach ! Behold, it \add is\add* laid over with gold and silver , and \add there is\add* no breath at all in the midst of it.
But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* in his holy temple : let all the earth keep silence before him.\f + \fr 2.20 \ft let…: Heb. be silent all the earth before him\f*
